channel.title: ourfishfamily
channel.description: Welcome to our Fish Family blog and our family gallery. Add us to your bookmarks and stay a while… grab a beer or a glass of wine, kick up your feet, splurge on a tub of bon-bons (yummo), sit back, relax and enjoy — Happy Reading! M&M

item.title: happy birthday mitchy
item.dc:creator: ourfishfamily
item.content:encoded:
Fifteen?! Seriously, kid… you have got to stop doing this. Enough is enough. It seems like every time we turn around, you are back at it again, blowing out candles and growing older. How about putting a pause on the birthdays for a year or two! But I guess, the pause button isn’t working so we’re moving along, full steam ahead!

Today is your day. You have been loved for 15 years; 180 months that is 782 weeks which equals 5,475 days (and nights), 131,400 hours which is 7 million eight hundred and eighty four thousand minutes. In summary, we love you LOTS!!!

As in all years we like to reflect on your birthday and capture a few memories of this stage in your life. So many beautiful thoughts come to my mind that make us smile when thinking of you. You are a wonderful son, a great big brother to your sister (who loves you very much), a kind friend and a strong student athlete excelling in both academics and athletics. You coined yourself the hype-man of the family and no one is arguing that to be the thruth! Your humor and way of finding the good in every situation is special to who you are and something we all learn from you each day.

We are continually impressed with your unruffled attitude, you call your “Pringle on your shoulder”. We know you wanted to be playing on the Green Frosh basketball team this year, but you were asked to play on Silver. For so many people that would have been so disheartening. Most would have quit or put in minimal effort. Instead, you gave yourself two days to vent, then you moved on. You not only accepted your team placement, you excelled on Silver! Top scorer, starter and undisputed leader. The team parents see it, your coaches see it, the basketball Director at DLS sees it, and we see it. Keep up your positive attitude and don’t let anyone hold you back, just work hard and prove them wrong! You are amazing. 

We love how you are growing into a “gentleman” - everyone comments on what great manners you have, how you always shake people’s hands (ok with COVID you now fist-bump), and say your please and thank-yous. We know we repeat ourselves again and again on this, but you not only listen, you respond. We enjoy your sense of humor each Sunday when we bring out the book of “Manners for Teens”. You laugh and joke during each lesson. But you also take each theme to heart and take action. Keep it up, everyone notices! 

We are proud that you are learning and excelling at high school, a true student athlete! You always have something to add to conversations at home based on what you’ve learned at school. (Dad is proud that you now hate sugar ;-)) You found a job on campus helping out in the cafeteria, in exchange for free food, which you enjoy a lot! You are making some great new friends, always bleeding DLS green, and spending far too much money at the student store. Keep having fun every single day.

We are confident you were born to lead and can’t wait to see what you do with your immense talent and unlimited potential. Your life has so much goodness ahead.

Happy Birthday Mitchy! 

All our love - Mom, Dad, Matilda & Maple

item.title: birthday-day unfolded
item.dc:creator: ourfishfamily
item.content:encoded:
This year the birthday-day was filled to the brim with school activities. We attempted to plan a few fun activities but the basketball schedule trumped all our plans so we worked with what we had and made the birthday-day as special as we could.

First up - birthday balloons, per usual. This year we attempted to get up early instead of in the middle of the night. Well that backfired on us and Mitchy greeted us at his door at 5:30am wide awake, ready to start the birthday festivities!

After the early morning fun, we took Mitchy to his 830am practice and surprised the team with birthday donuts after their workout. Then we were home for a few hours, were able to visit with Sonny and Judy, then turned back around to school for an evening of DLS basketball.

After the school basketball games ended, we went straight from school to the St Mary's game that evening with the DLS basketball teams. We had one other surprise in store for Mitchy. A friend helped us put a birthday message on the jumbotron, a fitting place to celebrate Mitchy as he's practically grown up in that gym!

The day was filled with birthday celebrations and basketball. Whew, come the end of the day, we were all tired!

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: A full day of birthday fun and basketball with our favorite birthday guy!

item.title: birthday night
item.dc:creator: ourfishfamily
item.content:encoded:
With the busy birthday-day we delayed birthday dinner to Sunday. Mitchy requested reverse seared steak, green beans, fruit salad and garlic bread. His dessert request was "Mama's ice cream" which is an ice cream sundae with homemade chocolate syrup, vanilla ice cream and bananas.

Given it was Mitchy's birthday, Matilda created a 'birthday special' and added it to the menu at Mama's ice cream shop. The new birthday sundae addition was a big hit and something that will remain on the menu for future birthday requests!

Mitch told us on Monday he was already missing his birthday. I don't blame him, we were sad his celebrations had ended, we all had lots of fun!

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Happiest of birthdays to our favorite 15 year old!

item.title: taxes
item.dc:creator: ourfishfamily
item.content:encoded: Working last summer as a basketball coach at St Mary's means Mitch had to file taxes this year to get his $23 back. Life skills coaching happening over here!

item.title: freshman basketball
item.dc:creator: ourfishfamily
item.content:encoded: 2nd to last game of the season. Mitch ended on a high note scoring 22 points personally. I think we will all be sad when this is all over!
